title: How to Make Healthy Mac and Cheese in a Slow Cooker

steps.headline: Combine the cheeses, milk, and macaroni in a slow cooker.
steps.description: Measure 4 cups (400 g) of reduced-fat shredded extra-sharp cheddar cheese, 3/4 cup (113 g) of crumbled gorgonzola cheese, 4 cups (946 ml) of fat-free milk, 5 1/3 cups (538 g) of dry whole wheat elbow macaroni, and 1/2 teaspoon (2 g) of salt into a slow cooker. Stir the ingredients until they're combined. The slow cooker should be at least 3 1/2 quarts (3.3 liters) in size. For the least calories, use fat-free milk. If you're trying to cut back on dairy or include more nuts in your diet, substitute almond milk.

steps.headline: Cook the noodles and cheese for one to two hours.
steps.description: Put the lid on the slow cooker and turn it to HIGH. Cook the mixture for one hour and check it to see if the noodles are soft. If they aren't, cook the mixture for another hour. If you want to cook the mac and cheese on LOW, check the casserole after two hours to see if the noodles are soft. It may take up to three or four hours for the casserole to cook.

steps.headline: Measure and mince the broccoli.
steps.description: Measure out 2 cups (350 g) of broccoli florets. Put them in a food processor or blender and put the lid on it. Pulse the broccoli until it's finely minced. This should take around 20 seconds. If you don't have a blender or food processor, chop the broccoli as finely as you can.

steps.headline: Stir the broccoli and arrowroot powder into the casserole.
steps.description: Take the lid off the slow cooker and add the minced broccoli. You'll also need to add 1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of arrowroot powder or cornstarch. Stir the mixture until the powder is dissolved and the broccoli is distributed.

steps.headline: Cook the healthy mac and cheese for 20 more minutes.
steps.description: Put the lid back on the slow cooker and ensure that the heat is set to HIGH. Cook the casserole for 20 more minutes to warm the broccoli and thicken the sauce. Serve the macaroni and cheese immediately. You can refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for three to five days. The noodles may become softer the longer you store them.

methods.name: Making Mac and Cheese with Squash

steps.headline: Boil the macaroni for five minutes.
steps.description: Bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat. Stir in 3 1/2 cups (340 g) of dry whole-wheat macaroni and set a timer for five minutes. Stir the noodles occasionally as they cook. Set a colander in a sink and drain the noodles into it. The macaroni shouldn't be completely soft since it will finish cooking in the slow cooker.

steps.headline: Prepare a slow cooker and measure the squash, milk, and yogurt into it.
steps.description: Spray a slow cooker with cooking spray or line it with a disposable slow cooker insert. Measure 1 cup (225 g) of canned pumpkin or butternut squash into it. Add 1 cup (240 ml) of fat-free milk and 1/2 cup (142 g) of plain Greek yogurt. The slow cooker should be at least 3 1/2 quarts (3.3 liters) in size.

steps.headline: Combine the cheeses, flour, and seasonings.
steps.description:
Get out a mixing bowl and put 3 cups (300 g) of shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese into it. Stir in 1/2 cup (50 g) of grated Parmesan cheese, 1/8 cup (15 g) of all-purpose flour, and these seasonings:
1 teaspoon (5 g) mustard powder
1/2 teaspoon (2 g) onion powder
1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) ground sage
1/4 teaspoon (1 g) garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon (1 g) salt
1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) ground black pepper

steps.headline: Stir the cheese mixture, noodles, and squash mixture.
steps.description: Transfer the seasoned cheese mixture to the slow cooker and add the drained macaroni noodles. Use a large spoon to stir the yogurt and squash mixture with the noodles and cheese until all of the ingredients are combined.

steps.headline: Cook the healthy mac and cheese for one to two hours.
steps.description: Put the lid on the slow cooker and turn it to HIGH. Cook the mixture for one hour and check it to see if the noodles are soft. If they aren't, cook the mixture for another hour. Stir the noodles occasionally. Serve the mac and cheese right away. You could also cook the casserole on LOW. Stir and check the noodles after two hours to see if they're soft. Store leftover mac and cheese in an airtight container. Refrigerate it for three to five days.

methods.name: Making High-Fiber Cauliflower Mac and Cheese

steps.headline: Boil the macaroni for four minutes.
steps.description: Bring a large pot of water to boil over high heat. Stir in 1 1/2 cups (150 g) of dry high-fiber elbow macaroni and set a timer for four minutes. Stir the noodles occasionally as they cook. Set a colander in a sink and drain the noodles into it. The macaroni will be al dente so it can finish cooking in the slow cooker.

steps.headline: Prepare the slow cooker and mix in the cauliflower and seasonings.
steps.description:
Spray a slow cooker with cooking spray or line it with a slow cooker insert. Chop 6 cups (642 g) of cauliflower into 1/2-inch (12-mm) pieces and transfer it to the slow cooker. Stir in 2 teaspoons (5 g) of minced garlic and the rest of the seasonings. You'll need:
1/2 teaspoon (2 g) onion powder
1/4 teaspoon (1 g) salt
1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) black pepper

steps.headline: Stir in the milk and noodles.
steps.description: Pour 1/2 cup (120 ml) of fat-free milk into the slow cooker. Add the drained and cooked macaroni noodles. Stir the mixture until it's completely combined. Put the lid on the slow cooker.

steps.headline: Cook the mac and cheese for three hours.
steps.description: Turn the slow cooker on to LOW and cook the casserole for three hours. Stir the noodles and check to see that they're soft. The chopped cauliflower should be easy to cut with a fork.

steps.headline: Melt and stir the cheeses together.
steps.description: Open five wedges (105 g) of creamy Swiss cheese and put them in a microwave-safe bowl. Stir the cheese wedges until they become totally smooth and add 1/4 cup (57 g) of light sour cream. Tear four slices (80 g) of reduced-fat cheddar cheese into pieces and add them to the bowl. Microwave the cheeses for 40 seconds. Carefully stir the hot cheese and microwave it for 40 more seconds. The cheeses should be completely melted and smooth.

steps.headline: Stir the cheese into the slow cooker and serve the casserole.
steps.description: Take the lid off of the slow cooker and scoop in the melted cheese mixture. Stir the cheese into the cooked noodle and cauliflower mixture until the noodles are coated. Serve the healthy mac and cheese right away. Refrigerate any leftovers in an airtight container for three to five days.
